title: State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes, and Lies - Collection 19 (Inj
description:
State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes, and Lies - Collection 19 (Injustice):

We have 35 titles in this upload. They all discuss injustice and failures of the justice system. Some of the injustice is unintentional, but most of it is a manifestation of state-sponsored terrorism and crimes.

-  Aladjem - The Culture of Vengeance and the Fate of American Justice (2008)

-  Amnesty Int. - Russian Federation; Rule Without Law; Human Rights Violations in the North Caucasus (2009)

-  Amnesty Int. - The Circle of Injustice; Security Operations and Human Rights Violations in Ingushetia (2012)

-  Bravin - The Terror Courts; Rough Justice at Guantanamo Bay (2013)

-  Compton-Wallace - Eating the Ashes; Seeking Rehabilitation within the US Penal System (2003)

-  Corlett - Race, Rights, and Justice (2009)

-  Cucullu - Inside Gitmo; the True Story behind the Myths of Guantanamo Bay (2009)

-  de Londras - Detention in the 'War on Terror'; Can Human Rights Fight Back (2011)

-  Dorling - Injustice; Why Social Inequality Persists (2010)

-  Ebisike - Offender Profiling in the Courtroom; the Use and Abuse of Expert Witness Testimony (2008)

-  Eddleston - Miscarriages of Justice; Famous London Cases (2009)

-  Edlin - Judges and Unjust Laws; Common Law Constitutionalism and the Foundations of Judicial Review (2010)

-  Fabre - Justice in a Changing World (2007)

-  Felman - The Juridical Unconscious; Trials and Traumas in the Twentieth Century (2002)

-  Haas - The Assassination of Fred Hampton; How the FBI and the Chicago Police Murdered a Black Panther (2010)

-  HRW - An Offer You Can't Refuse; How US Federal Prosecutors Force Drug Defendants to Plead Guilty (2013)

-  HRW - In the Name of Security; Counterterrorism Laws Worldwide since September 11 (2012)

-  HRW - No One Left to Witness; Torture, the Failure of Habeas Corpus, and the Silencing of Lawyers in Uzbekistan (2011)

-  HRW - Where Is the Justice; Interethnic Violence in Southern Kyrgyzstan and Its Aftermath (2010)

-  Lanier & Page - A Mighty Long Way; My Journey to Justice at Little Rock Central High School (2009)

-  Lesley - Los Angeles Police Department Meltdown; the Fall of the Professional-Reform Model of Policing (2012)

-  Levy & Sidel (Eds.) - Social Injustice and Public Health (2006)

-  MacIntyre - Whose Justice; Which Rationality (1988)

-  Maxeiner - Failures of American Civil Justice in International Perspective (2011)

-  May - Global Justice and Due Process (2011)

-  Miller - Search and Destroy; African-American Males in the Criminal Justice System (1996)

-  Mullins - The Rape of Justice; America's Tribunals Exposed (1989)

-  Natapoff - Snitching; Criminal Informants and the Erosion of American Justice (2009)

-  Provine - Unequal Under Law; Race in the War on Drugs (2007)

-  Richman & Reynolds - Injustice on Appeal; the United States Courts of Appeals in Crisis (2013)

-  Roberts & Stratton - The Tyranny of Good Intentions; How Prosecutors and Law Enforcement Are Trampling the Constitution (2008)

-  Taibbi - The Divide; American Injustice in the Age of the Wealth Gap (2014)

-  Tribe & Matz - Uncertain Justice; the Roberts Court and the Constitution (2014)

-  Wang - Becoming American; the Art and Identity Crisis of Yasuo Kuniyoshi (2011)
